message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This paper uses data on agricultural land use sourced from the United States Department of Agriculture and complemented with data on weather patterns from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to identify factors driving land use change.", "dataset": ["United States Department of Agriculture", "National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using the IMF's Debt Sustainability Analysis dataset, we analyze debt vulnerabilities in low-income countries while also incorporating demographic data from the World Bank to assess the potential impact of population growth on future debt levels.", "dataset": ["IMF's Debt Sustainability Analysis dataset", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Debt"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on data from both the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Goldman Sachs Small Business Survey to examine the relationship between firm size and competitiveness indicators in emerging economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Goldman Sachs Small Business Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize a unique dataset compiled from satellite imagery, field surveys, and local stakeholder engagement efforts to evaluate the effectiveness of disaster risk reduction initiatives in coastal areas of Bangladesh.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "field surveys"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "In this analysis, we draw on multiple datasets including the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Education Database and the World Bank's Learning Poverty database to investigate disparities in education access and quality across Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Education Database", "World Bank's Learning Poverty database"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of data sources including the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct project and NASA's GRACE satellite mission to evaluate water scarcity risks and management strategies in a region of Northern India highly dependent on groundwater resources.", "dataset": ["World Resources Institute's Aqueduct project", "GRACE satellite mission"], "topic": ["Water", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the United Nations Development Programme's Human Development Index as well as household survey data collected across Indonesia, we investigate the relationship between energy access and inequality in the country.", "dataset": ["United Nations Development Programme's Human Development Index"], "topic": ["Energy", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes data from multiple sources including the EITI Standard's Reporting Template and national tax authority records to evaluate revenue management practices in the extractive industries sector of Ghana.", "dataset": ["EITI Standard's Reporting Template", "national tax authority records"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage A/B testing data collected by the Mexican microfinance institution FinComún as well as consumer survey data from the World Bank Global Financial Inclusion Database to explore potential biases in credit scoring models for low-income borrowers.", "dataset": ["Mexican microfinance institution FinComún", "World Bank Global Financial Inclusion Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Data Analytics"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses survey data collected by the National Nutrition Monitoring Bureau alongside government data on food fortification initiatives to investigate the drivers of malnutrition in children under five years old in India.", "dataset": ["National Nutrition Monitoring Bureau"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}]
